intro: Breynia rhamnoides var. genuina, commonly known as the Cape rush or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils. The plant has small, oval leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature. Breynia rhamnoides var. genuina is also known for its ability to thrive in saline environments.
